subject: add support for sparse images to filesystem driver

Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Would you mind functionally testing this in glance/tests/functional/store/test_filesystem.py? You should be able to add a custom test method to the TestFilesystemStore class.

Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Why not use simple string comparisons instead of a regex here? Quick tests shows that comparing string (compare buf to ZEROS, ZEROS being '\x00'*ChunkedFile.CHUNKSIZE) is quicker (from 20% for a 20G non-sparse file but with only 70Mb of real data, to 60% for the same file but stored sparse on the filesystem).

Another thing: there is no need to call f.truncate() at each loop iteration. Calling at the end is enough togarantee the created file is the correct size.

Patch Set 10: (1 inline comment)

Thanks Christian that would be great!  Also one more question in-line.

Patch Set 10: (1 inline comment)

All looks good to me, apart from the config option.
Can you detail why it's needed, rather than just
falling back to a write if truncate() fails.

thanks.

Patch Set 10:

@p-draigbrady: I can change it to a try-except block, trying to use truncate and if that's not possible using write. I personally prefer configuration options to be able to explicitly disable features I don't want to use. But it's okay for me to change this if it's the preferred way for an implementation. Also will change it this way in the Nova part.
